definition: abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all

sentences.english: Had the board brought in a new face too early, it might have attracted mud.
sentences.chinese: 倘若董事會提早推出一張新面孔，可能會招致非議。

sentences.english: Obama's silence on the Israeli action has led to some sniping abroad.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬對以巴衝突的緘默引發了境外部分人士的非議。

sentences.english: This likeness unquestionably included the ability to engage in intelligible speech via human language.
sentences.chinese: 這種相似性無可非議地包括使用人類的語言的能力。

sentences.english: He flies in the face of public disapproval.
Although this kind of type suffers censure quite, but I think also cannot to sum up in a word.
sentences.chinese: 儘管這種類型頗受非議，但我認爲也不能一言以蔽之。

sentences.english: From my point of view, Fan's behavior of the escaping first itself is above exception.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，範美忠先跑的行爲本身是無可非議的。

sentences.english: The intellectual sources for these prejudices are, however, impeccable.
sentences.chinese: 這些學術偏見的根源倒也無可非議。

sentences.english: But despite these complaints, people like more trees on the street.
sentences.chinese: 儘管非議不斷，但是民衆還是喜歡綠樹成蔭的街道。
他的作爲是無可非議的。

sentences.english: Fantasy as a genre is often unfairly maligned.
sentences.chinese: 奇幻題材的小說常常遭到不公的非議。

sentences.english: It is all very well for such tings to occur in fiction.
sentences.chinese: 這種事發生在小說中是無可非議的。

sentences.english: His manners are beyond reproach. everyone owns his right to live his life.
sentences.chinese: 他的舉止是無可非議人人都擁有自己生活的權利。

sentences.english: But it could just in part because it means escaping the stigma of singlehood .
sentences.chinese: 但這可能只是因爲他逃避了單身生活的非議。

sentences.english: Such behavior cannot pass in a schoolroom.
sentences.chinese: 這種行爲在教室裏肯定要遭到非議。

definition: frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
to hurl abuse/to deride/to call sb names
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
